content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?> <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "http://www.fgdc.gov/metadata/fgdc-std-001-1998.dtd"[]> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service</origin>         <pubdate>May 1, 2014</pubdate>         <title>National Wetlands Inventory - Riparian Project Metadata</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>         <serinfo></serinfo>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Washington, D.C.</pubplace>           <publish>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Other/Riparian-Product-Summary.html</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>This data set represents the extent, status, and location of current NWI riparian mapping projects.  Each project polygon contains information on the type and date of imagery used to map the riparian habitats and a link to a document about specific mapping techniques and habitat information for that project.</abstract>       <purpose>The present goal of the Service is to provide the citizens of the United States and its Trust Territories with current geospatially referenced information on the status and extent of riparian mapping.</purpose>       <supplinf>This dataset was created to be used as auxillary information to the Riparian Areas of the Western United States.</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <rngdates>           <begdate>1977</begdate>           <enddate>present</enddate>         </rngdates>       </timeinfo>       <current>ground condition</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Ongoing</progress>       <update>In Continuous Increments</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc> Acknowledgement of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and (or) the National Wetlands Inventory would be appreciated in products derived from these data</useconst>     <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntpos>National Standards and Support Team</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>           <address>505 Science Drive</address>           <city>Madison</city>           <state>WI</state>           <postal>53711</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>608-238-9333</cntvoice>         <cntfax>608-238-9334</cntfax>         <cntemail>wetlands_team@fws.gov</cntemail>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>     <browse>       <browsed>Topical overlay showing the extent and approximate location of current NWI riparian mapping.</browsed>     </browse>     <native>Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.1 build 4400 service pack 5</native>     <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <origin>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Serivce, National Wetlands Inventory</origin>         <pubdate>Various</pubdate>         <edition>Version 1.0</edition>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Washington, D.C.  USA</pubplace>           <publish>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service</publish>         </pubinfo>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <attracc>       <attraccr>The source data was checked using standard review procedures. Attributes were checked by using visual inspection as well as field domains.  Quality of the attribute information varies with age and mapping protocols used when individual maps were prepared</attraccr>       <qattracc>         <attraccv>All polygons are attributed.</attraccv>       </qattracc>     </attracc>     <logic>Polygon and chain-node topology are present.</logic>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Fish and Service</enttypds>       </enttyp>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>Polygon</edomv>             <edomvd>2-dimensional element.</edomvd>             <edomvds>ESRI GIS software</edomvds>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>PROJECT_NAME</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Name of the wetland mapping project.</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SUPPMAPINFO</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Hyperlink URL to the Supplemental Map Information document related to this project area</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>STATUS</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Current status of the project</attrdef>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>Completed</edomv>             <edomvd>The project is completed and on the Wetlands Mapper for public viewing</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>No_Data</edomv>             <edomvd>This project/area represents an area where no wetlands mapping has been conducted</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>Non-Digital</edomv>             <edomvd>Represents a project/area where mapping onto traditional hardcopy media has been conducted. No digital data exists for this area.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>Scan</edomv>             <edomvd>This represents a project/area where a traditional hardcopy map has been scanned and may be displayed on the Wetlands Mapper.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>Current</edomv>             <edomvd>This project/area contains the metadata for the data currently in the MGD</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>FGDC_METADATA</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Link to FGDC metadata for the Riparian dataset.</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>IMAGE_YR</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Year of the most recent imagery used for wetland delineation</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>IMAGE_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Month and year of all imagery used for wetland delineation</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DATA_SOURCE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Source of the data (what orgainization created the wetlands data)</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>COMMENTS</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Specific comments about project.</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>EMULSION</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Emulsion type of the imagery used to delineate wetlands.</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>IMAGE_SCALE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The best image scale used for wetland delineation represented by the representative fraction (RF) denominator or a generalization of ground resolution for digital imagery (0 = unknown, 1 = < = equal to 1 meter, 2 =  > 1 and <= 2 meters,  3 = > 2 < = 3 meters.</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>ALL_SCALES</attrlabl>         <attrdef>All the image scales or resolutions of the imagery used for delineating the wetlands</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>IMAGE_TYPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The best imagery emulsion type from all the types used to delineate the wetlands for a given project area. The order of hierarchy from best to worst is CIR for Color Infrared, TC for Natural or True color, BW for Black and White, and Unknown</attrdef>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GLOBALID</attrlabl>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE_Length</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Length of feature in internal units.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE_Area</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Area of feature in internal units squared.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntpos>National Standards and Support Team</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>           <address>505 Science Drive</address>           <city>Madison</city>           <state>WI</state>           <postal>53711</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>608-238-9333</cntvoice>         <cntfax>608-238-9334</cntfax>         <cntemail>wetlands_team@fws.gov</cntemail>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <resdesc>Downloadable Data</resdesc>     <distliab>Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
